concurrent_multiset

Class MultisetLock

  • java.lang.Object
    • concurrent_multiset.MultisetLock

  • public class MultisetLock
extends java.lang.Object

    The definition of a lock utilized to block the ConcurrentMultiset.add(Object, int) and ConcurrentMultiset.remove(Object, int) operations while someone is executing a ConcurrentMultiset.removeAll(Collection) on the multiset. The implementation of the lock is based on a boolean variable, declared volatile (all the threads are guaranteed to see the updated value of the variable because the read and write operations are addressed to the main memory, bypassing the cache).

    This choice has been made in order to avoid losing the results of other concurrent operations performed on the multiset during the ConcurrentMultiset.removeAll(Collection) method execution.

    Author:
    Alessandra Fais
